message.content:
cs.NE, cs.ET, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) - The paper discusses the implementation of a neuromorphic VLSI substrate for Gibbs sampling using spiking digital neurons. This falls under the domain of neural computing and hence, cs.NE is the most likely sub-category.
2. cs.ET (Emerging Technologies) - The paper presents a hardware-based implementation of Gibbs sampling using digital spiking neurons, which can be considered an emerging technology in the field of computing. Hence, cs.ET is a likely sub-category.
3. cs.LG (Machine Learning) - Restricted Boltzmann Machines and Deep Belief Networks, which are the focus of the paper, are popular machine learning algorithms. Hence, cs.LG is a likely sub-category.
4. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) - The paper discusses the implementation of a hardware-based sampler for inference tasks, which is a key component of many AI applications. Hence, cs.AI is a likely sub-category.
5. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper presents some key performance metrics for the hardware-based sampler, which can be considered a control system. Hence, cs.SY is a possible sub-category.
